post_title: European police chiefs target E2EE in latest demand for 'lawful access'
title: Balancing Privacy & Public Safety: European Police Chiefs' Call for E2EE Access
post_content:
THE ONGOING CRYPTO WARS: A CALL FOR BALANCING PRIVACY AND PUBLIC SAFETY IN END-TO-END ENCRYPTION

In the latest episode of the crypto wars, UK's National Crime Agency (NCA) director general, Graeme Biggar, has urged Meta (formerly Facebook) to reconsider its rollout of end-to-end encryption (E2EE) on Instagram. This appeal follows a joint declaration by European police chiefs, including the UK's, expressing concerns about the expanding use of E2EE by tech companies and its impact on identifying and reporting illegal activities.

The NCA's Biggar highlighted the challenge in protecting the public from organized crime while ensuring child safety, emphasizing the need for information access. Currently, platforms can send tens of millions of child safety-related reports annually to global police forces, resulting in the safeguarding of 1,200 children and the arrest of 800 individuals monthly. However, Meta's E2EE expansion to Instagram may hinder this process.

Despite supporting encryption to ensure privacy and cybersecurity, Biggar insisted that tech companies should develop solutions to provide law enforcement with necessary information. This stance aligns with the joint declaration, which calls for the industry to adopt unspecified technical solutions to maintain the ability to spot and report illegal activities while preserving robust security and privacy.

The declaration does not explicitly mention client-side scanning, but it seems to be the suggested technology. Apple planned to roll out such a system in 2021 for detecting child sexual abuse material (CSAM) on devices, but privacy and legal concerns led to its postponement. The European Council has also adopted a resolution for lawful access to encrypted data, while the European Commission proposed a controversial message-scanning CSAM legislative plan.

Although parliamentarians revised the Commission's proposal to limit the scope of CSAM detection orders, the European Council has not yet reached an agreement. In response, over 60 civil society groups and privacy experts warned that the proposed "mass surveillance" law remains a threat to E2EE, and EU lawmakers agreed to extend a temporary derogation from the bloc's ePrivacy rules, allowing platforms to perform voluntary scanning for CSAM.

As the crypto wars continue, striking a balance
meta_desc:
Balance privacy and public safety in end-to-end encryption. Learn how European police chiefs and tech leaders navigate challenges for user security and crime-fighting. CryptoWars Privacy PublicSafety

(17 words)
focuskeywords: Between PRIVACY and PUBLIC SAFETY in END-TO-END ENCRYPTION remains a complex challenge for all stakeholders involved. The need for robust encryption to protect users' privacy and cybersecurity must be weighed against the necessity of providing law enforcement with access to critical information for safeguarding the public and ensuring child safety. As European police chiefs call for technical solutions that maintain the ability to spot and report illegal activities, it is paramount that the industry continues to engage in constructive dialogue to address these concerns while preserving the essential principles of privacy and security.

post_title: A coffee roastery in Finland has launched an AI-generated blend. The results were surprising
title: AI Crafts Unique 4-Bean Coffee Blend in Finland
post_content:
Title: A Symphony of Flavors: The AI-conic Coffee Blend Revolution

Artificial intelligence has been making waves in various industries, and now it's making a bold entrance into the world of coffee. A Helsinki-based artisan roastery, Kaffa Roastery, in collaboration with local AI consultancy Elev, has introduced an innovative coffee blend called "AI-conic." This unique concoction is the first of its kind, developed with the help of artificial intelligence, in a trial aimed at easing the workload in a sector that traditionally cherishes manual labor.

Finland, a nation of 5.6 million people, is renowned for its coffee consumption, with an impressive average of 12 kilograms per capita annually. It is only fitting that this groundbreaking blend was launched in the heart of this coffee-loving country. The AI-conic blend is a harmonious mixture of four types of beans, predominantly Brazil's velvety Fazenda Pinhal, with additional flavors from Colombia, Ethiopia, and Guatemala.

The collaboration between Kaffa Roastery and Elev involved leveraging AI models similar to ChatGPT and Copilot. These models were tasked with creating a blend that would cater to coffee enthusiasts' tastes, pushing the boundaries of conventional flavor combinations. The AI was supplied with detailed descriptions of all Kaffa's coffee types and their flavors. It was then instructed to craft a new, exciting blend, which resulted in the creation of the AI-conic blend.

Interestingly, the AI chose to create the blend using four different types of coffee beans, a decision that surprised Kaffa Roastery's founder, Svante Hampf. Traditionally, coffee blends use two or three types of beans to allow for distinct taste variations between origins. However, after the initial test roasting and blind testing, Kaffa's coffee experts agreed that the AI-assisted blend was perfect and required no human adjustments.

The AI didn't just stop at crafting the blend; it also designed the package label and created a detailed taste description. According to the AI, the AI-conic blend offers a well-balanced sweetness and ripe fruit flavors. Hampf admits to being initially surprised by the four-bean blend but was

post_title: U.S. House passes revised bill to ban TikTok or force sale
title: The U.S. House passed a bill forcing ByteDance to sell TikTok or face a ban. The nine-month window for divestiture is a response to concerns about potential data collection for the Chinese government. The bill received broad support and is now in the Senate's hands. This situation highlights the complex balance between national security, data privacy, and digital rights.
post_content:
Title: The TikTok Dilemma: Balancing National Security and Digital Rights

The U.S. House of Representatives has recently approved a bill that could either force ByteDance to sell TikTok or face a ban within the United States. This development is reminiscent of efforts initiated during the Trump Administration, which have resurfaced in recent months.

In the current bill, TikTok's parent company is granted a nine-month window to sell the popular app, with an additional 90-day extension allowed at the President's discretion. This adjustment appears to have addressed some Senate objections, with Senator Maria Cantwell (D-Washington) suggesting the extension to ensure a more likely divestiture.

The bill received widespread support, passing with a 360-58 majority, and is part of a larger package also containing foreign aid for Ukraine, Israel, and Taiwan. The inclusion of the TikTok bill might have been a strategic move to garner more conservative support. If the Senate adopts the package and it receives President Biden's approval, TikTok is expected to challenge the decision in court.

Both the Biden Administration and House Foreign Affairs Committee chair Michael McCaul (R-Texas) have expressed concerns about the app. They cite potential data collection on American users for the Chinese government and the use of TikTok as a propaganda channel. McCaul even referred to the app as "a spy balloon in Americans' phones." However, TikTok has previously denied these allegations.

The company, in response to the revived bill, released a statement asserting that the House is attempting to "trample the free speech rights of 170 million Americans, devastate 7 million businesses, and shutter a platform." Likewise, civil liberties groups such as the Electronic Frontier Foundation and American Civil Liberties Union have previously opposed app ban efforts.

This situation raises complex questions about national security, data privacy, and digital rights. While addressing national security concerns is crucial, it is essential to consider the potential consequences of a ban on American users, businesses, and free speech. As the situation unfolds, striking a delicate balance between these competing interests will be paramount.
meta_desc: "TikTok Ban Revived: Navigating National Security, Privacy, and Free Speech. Explore the controversy & 170M American users' impact."
focuskeywords:
TikTok Ban: Balancing National Security and Digital Rights

The U.S. House passes revised bill to ban TikTok or force sale

post_title: EU opens probe of TikTok Lite, citing concerns about addictive design
post_content:
TikTok, the popular video-sharing platform, faces a second formal investigation by the European Union (EU) over potential violations of the Digital Services Act (DSA). This online governance and content moderation framework aims to ensure that tech companies prioritize user safety and privacy. The EU has expressed concerns about TikTok Lite, a new version of the app launched in France and Spain, which features a "task and reward" mechanism that could negatively impact the mental health of young users.

The EU has given TikTok until April 24 to respond to the allegations, but the app remains accessible for now. Penalties for confirmed DSA violations can reach up to 6% of a company's global annual turnover. As a result, TikTok's parent company, ByteDance, could face hefty fines if found guilty of breaking the law.

This second probe focuses specifically on TikTok Lite, following an ongoing investigation into multiple aspects of the platform's DSA compliance since December. The EU is concerned that ByteDance failed to conduct and submit a risk assessment report before launching the "Task and Reward Lite" program, particularly regarding its impact on mental health, especially among minors.

The EU has accused ByteDance of failing to produce the requested risk assessment document, which could lead to fines of up to 1% of the company's total annual income or worldwide turnover, as well as periodic penalties of up to 5% of average daily income or worldwide annual turnover.

The DSA applies stricter regulations to larger platforms, requiring them to proactively identify and mitigate systemic risks. The EU suspects that ByteDance failed to comply with these requirements before launching TikTok Lite in the EU markets.

Thierry Breton, the EU commissioner for the Internal Market, released a statement emphasizing the importance of protecting children from potential harm caused by excessive screen time and addictive app features. He warned that the EU would take action against TikTok if the company fails to provide compelling proof of the app's safety.

As of press time, ByteDance had not responded to the EU's latest enforcement action. The EU's crackdown on TikTok reflects its commitment to ensuring user safety and privacy while holding tech companies accountable for potential violations of the DSA. By
meta_desc: Investigate TikTok Lite's impact on young users' mental health; EU launches DSA compliance probe. Respond by April 24 to avoid potential fines.
focuskeywords:
Investigating TikTok Lite
Prompted by concerns over addictive design, the European Union opens a formal investigation into TikTok Lite, a new version of the popular video-sharing app. The EU's Digital Services Act (DSA) compliance probe aims to safeguard user safety and privacy, particularly among young users.

In December, the EU launched an initial investigation into TikTok, focusing on multiple DSA compliance aspects. This second probe concentrates specifically on TikTok Lite, alleging that ByteDance failed to submit a risk assessment report on the app's "Task and Reward Lite" program.

The EU is particularly concerned about the potential negative impact of this feature on mental health, especially among minors. If ByteDance is found guilty of breaking the DSA, it could face fines of up to 6% of its global annual turnover, as well as periodic penalties.

Thierry Breton, the EU commissioner for the Internal Market, emphasizes the importance of protecting children from potential harm caused by excessive screen time and addictive app features. The EU's crackdown on TikTok highlights its dedication to upholding user safety and privacy while enforcing accountability among tech companies.

post_title: Fintech startup Ramp sees 32% bump in valuation, Mercury expands into consumer banking
title: Fintech Ramp's Valuation Surges, Mercury Enters Consumer Banking, Klarna's US Credit Card Launch
post_content:
Welcome to the Fintech Focus, where we bring you the latest news and insights in the world of financial technology. This week, we're diving into Ramp's record-breaking fundraising, Mercury's expansion into personal banking, Klarna's new credit card, and much more!

Ramp's Rapid Rise

Ramp, a spend management startup, recently raised $150 million at a $7.65 billion valuation, continuing its rapid growth. Co-led by Khosla Ventures and Founders Fund, this latest round represents a 31.9% valuation increase from its August 2023 raise. What makes Ramp so attractive to investors? According to CEO Eric Glyman, it's the company's commitment to AI and continuous growth.

Mercury's Personal Banking Pivot

Business banking platform Mercury is venturing into personal banking, aiming to convert its 100,000+ business clients into personal account holders. Although business and personal banking are different beasts, Mercury has a head start with its established B2B presence.

Klarna's Credit Card Debut

Swedish fintech giant Klarna has entered the U.S. credit card market, offering an alternative to Apple, Robinhood, and Affirm. With the Klarna credit card, users can access buy now, pay later (BNPL) options, rewards, and more.

Fintech Funding & Investment News

- finmid, an embedded fintech startup, raised $24.7 million in a Series A round at a $107 million post-money valuation.
- Pula, an insurtech serving small-holder farmers in emerging markets, secured $20 million in Series B funding.
- Midas, a fintech enabling investments in U.S. and Turkish equities, raised $45 million in a funding round led by Portage of Canada.
- HR/fintech startup Rippling is reportedly raising $200 million, with $670 million in shares sold by existing stockholders.

Additional Fintech Stories

- Google Wallet has launched in India with local integrations, challenging Pay's dominance.
- India's government is working to curb PhonePe and Google's mobile payment market
meta_desc: "Discover fintech's surge: Ramp's $7.65B valuation, Mercury's personal banking, Klarna's credit card. Fintech funding news & more! Act now - Stay informed!"

post_title: Seraphim Space launches second VC fund with nine investments already under its belt
title: Seraphim Space Launches Second VC Fund: AI, Space Data, and In-Orbit Computing
post_content:
Seraphim Space Launches Second VC Fund, Building on a Successful Track Record

Seraphim Space, a UK-based venture capital group specializing in space technology, has announced the launch of its second VC fund. Having already made nine investments, the new fund, SSV II, aims to raise a significant sum, surpassing the £70 million ($90 million) raised by its predecessor in 2017. The fund will focus on early-stage startups working on seed and Series A rounds, with the goal of creating a global portfolio of 30 companies.

Fund Details and Strategy

Although CEO Mark Boggett declined to disclose the current percentage reached or the targeted size of the new fund, he confirmed that it should be larger than the first fund. The fund's strategy remains consistent, targeting investment in space tech startups with significant potential for growth and innovation.

Working with major players in the aerospace sector, Seraphim Space aims to help these established companies stay connected to emerging trends and technologies. While the market for space tech has become increasingly competitive and attracted more interest from generalist and specialist investors, Seraphim Space hopes to distinguish itself through its strong track record and industry expertise.

Track Record and Success Stories

Seraphim Space's first fund has already demonstrated success, returning three times the original investment. This success was driven in part by five exits, including the trade sale of UltraSoC to Siemens and the IPOs of Arqit, AST SpaceMobile, Nightingale, and Spire Global.

However, recent market conditions have affected both the firm's portfolio companies and Seraphim Space itself. The firm's growth fund, Seraphim Space Investment Trust (SSIT), listed on the London Stock Exchange in July 2021 with £250 million in gross proceeds but has since experienced a decrease in market capitalization due to challenging public market conditions, especially for tech listings.

Investment Themes and Focus Areas

SSV II will focus on four key themes: the application of AI to space data, in-orbit computing, space-enabled communications, and microgravity for science. Some of the fund's investments include insurtech startup Delos and carbon credit verification platform Renoster, both leveraging space data and AI for climate change
meta_desc: "Seraphim Space's SSV II: Investing in AI-powered space data, in-orbit computing, space-enabled comms, & microgravity. Join our global portfolio of 30 space tech startups."

Fasten your seatbelts as we delve into earnings season, the electric vehicle (EV) price wars, and the latest venture capital fund announcements. We'll also examine the emerging landscape of vector databases and search, where startups and tech giants face off to revolutionize artificial intelligence (AI) queries.

The tech world is gearing up for earnings season, with companies such as Microsoft, Amazon, Alphabet, and Apple set to report their Q1 2023 financial results. Investors and analysts will be eagerly watching these reports to gauge the health of the tech sector and gain insights into the impact of recent economic trends.

Meanwhile, several high-profile tech companies are preparing to go public this year, including Instacart, Reddit, and Discord. As we await these IPOs, let's not forget the lessons learned from recent stock market fluctuations and the ongoing bitcoin halving event, which has yet to significantly impact the cryptocurrency's value.

Venture Capital Funds

Two new venture capital funds caught our attention this week. Seraphim, a London-based venture capital firm, has announced a new space-focused fund to invest in startups developing products and services for the rapidly growing space industry. With this new fund, Seraphim aims to capitalize on the increasing commercialization of space, driven by advancements in satellite technology, reusable rockets, and miniaturization.

TLcom Capital, a venture capital firm focused on African tech startups, has also unveiled a new fund. This $150 million fund will support the growth of promising African startups in sectors such as fintech, healthtech, and agritech. TLcom's commitment to the continent's tech ecosystem will help drive innovation and economic growth across Africa.

post_title: AlmaLinux 9.4 beta is out: 4 reasons to consider it for your desktop
title: AlmaLinux: Secure, Stable Desktop & Server OS with 10-Year Support
post_content:
Title: AlmaLinux: A Secure and Stable Operating System for Both Server and Desktop Use

Introduction

AlmaLinux, a rock-solid and secure operating system, has recently released its beta version. While it is primarily designed for server usage, this article explores the potential of AlmaLinux as an enterprise-grade desktop operating system. With security and stability at its core, AlmaLinux offers several advantages that make it an attractive option for users seeking a reliable and long-term desktop solution.

AlmaLinux as a Server Operating System

The latest AlmaLinux 9.4 beta focuses on package updates and security improvements. Key updates include Python 3.1, Ruby 3.3, PHP 8.2, NGINX 1.24, MariaDB 10.11, PostgreSQL 16, Git 2.43.0, LFS 3.4.1, and more. Security enhancements consist of SELinux userspace 3.6, OpenSSL TLS toolkit, and updated Linux kernel cryptographic API. Users can upgrade to the new version with the following commands:

1. sudo dnf install -y https://repo.almalinux.org/vault/almalinux-{release,repos,gpg-keys}-latest-9-beta.x86_64.rpm
2. sudo dnf clean all
3. sudo dnf upgrade -y

AlmaLinux for the Desktop

Despite its server-oriented design, AlmaLinux has features that make it suitable for desktop usage as well. Here are some reasons to consider AlmaLinux for your desktop:

1. Long-term support: AlmaLinux 9.x is supported until 2032, providing a decade of updates and security patches.
2. Security: AlmaLinux offers enhanced security compared to many desktop operating systems, making it an excellent choice for users handling sensitive data.
3. Stability: AlmaLinux focuses on stability, ensuring that software is thoroughly tested and vetted before inclusion in the distribution.
4. Flatpak support: Although not all applications are available in the standard repositories, AlmaLinux supports Flatpak, enabling users to install apps from
meta_desc:
Meta Description:

Discover AlmaLinux, a secure and stable operating system for servers and desktops. With long-term support, enhanced security, and stability, AlmaLinux offers a reliable solution for your desktop needs. Upgrade now to enjoy the latest package updates and security improvements.

Keywords: AlmaLinux, operating system, server, desktop, long-term support, security, stability, package updates, upgrade.

post_title: Tesla layoffs, Cybertruck recalls and Serve Robotics goes public
title: Tesla Layoffs, Cybertruck Recall: Federal AV Regulations Progress; Serve Robotics IPO
post_content:
Welcome to the Future of Transportation Weekly Roundup, where we keep you updated on the latest news and trends in the world of mobility. Don't miss out on the latest developments – sign up for our newsletter and get the scoop every week!

Tesla's eventful week

Tesla has been making headlines once again, with a series of events that kicked off with layoffs affecting approximately 10% of its 140,000-strong workforce. CEO Elon Musk announced that he would be "going balls to the wall" on autonomy, and the week ended with a recall of the Cybertruck. Before moving on, be sure to check out Sean O'Kane's exclusive on Tesla's 1,800-mile Tesla Semi charging corridor program.

Federal regulators close to publishing AV regulations

Our Washington, D.C. sources have informed us that federal regulators are nearing the release of a Notice of Proposed Rulemaking on autonomous vehicle regulations. This would be the first set of federal guidelines for the industry, establishing a minimum safety standard for AVs operating on public roads. While state governments could enforce stricter regulations within their borders, this marks a significant step towards federal guidelines for AVs.

Serve Robotics' public market debut

Serve Robotics, the Nvidia- and Uber-backed sidewalk robot delivery company, made its public market debut this week via a reverse merger. The company aims to increase its fleet from 100 robots deployed in Los Angeles to 2,000 across multiple U.S. cities by the end of 2025, in partnership with Uber Eats. Serve Robotics is targeting between $60 million and $80 million in annual revenue by that time.

Other deals and noteworthy reads

 Found Energy, a startup that converts waste aluminum into heat and hydrogen, raised a $12 million seed round.
 Getir, a Turkish delivery company, is considering asset sales and exits from non-core markets due to investor pressure to cut losses.
 Swtch Energy, a company building EV charging solutions for apartment buildings, raised $27.2 million in a Series B round.
 Mobileye secured orders for 46

post_title: Women in AI: Anna Korhonen studies the intersection between linguistics and AI
title: Anna Korhonen: Pioneering Responsible NLP in AI & Linguistics
post_content:
Title: Spotlight on Anna Korhonen: Pioneering Responsible Natural Language Processing

Introduction

In the rapidly evolving world of Artificial Intelligence (AI), it's crucial to recognize the contributions of women who are driving revolutionary changes. One such trailblazer is Anna Korhonen, a professor of Natural Language Processing (NLP) at the University of Cambridge. With her multidisciplinary background in computer science and linguistics, she focuses on developing human-centric NLP techniques. In this profile, we delve into her journey, achievements, and perspectives on the AI industry.

The Journey into AI

Anna Korhonen's fascination with human intelligence and language led her to pursue engineering and computer science. She specialized in AI, driven by her passion for combining her interests in linguistics and practical applications.

Achievements and Contributions

Throughout her career, Professor Korhonen has been committed to creating AI tools for social and global good. Her work includes developing NLP techniques that can help better understand complex diseases like cancer and dementia, as well as creating educational apps. Her mission is to develop AI that improves human lives, and she strives to inspire the next generation of AI scientists and leaders to focus on realizing AI's potential for positive impact.

Navigating the AI Industry

Despite working in a field with a sizable female population, Professor Korhonen acknowledges the challenges of the male-dominated tech and AI industries. She emphasizes the importance of gender balance, as it influences the priorities of both academia and industry. She encourages women in AI to actively network and support each other to achieve better gender representation, especially in leadership positions.

Pressing Issues in AI

Professor Korhonen highlights the need to prioritize human needs and safety as AI evolves. She stresses the importance of addressing concerns about AI's impact on jobs, democracy, and the environment. She encourages developers to consider ethics during AI development, rather than as an afterthought.

AI User Awareness

Korhonen advises users to be aware that current AI lacks the world knowledge and social context understanding of humans. While AI can be a useful tool for many tasks, she cautions against relying on it for critical decision-making or education.

Responsible AI
meta_desc:
Discover Anna Korhonen's pioneering work in responsible NLP: improving human lives, promoting gender balance, and prioritizing ethics in AI. Learn more at [website].

(16 words)

post_title: TLcom Capital closes second fund at $154M to back early-stage startups across Africa
title: TLcom Capital's $154M Fund Backs Early-Stage African Startups
post_content:
Title: African VC Firm TLcom Capital Closes $154M Fund, Continues to Focus on Early-Stage Startups

Introduction:

Venture capital activity in Africa has shown resilience amidst a global funding winter, with major firms on the continent closing their funds. TLcom Capital, an African VC firm with offices in Lagos and Nairobi, recently concluded fundraising for its second fund, TIDE Africa Fund II, totaling $154 million, becoming the largest investor across seed and Series A stages in the continent.

The Final Close and Participating Investors:

TLcom Capital's TIDE Africa Fund II had an initial target of $150 million and attracted over 20 limited partners. Notable investors include the European Investment Bank (EIB), Visa Foundation, Bertelsmann, and AfricaGrow, a joint venture between Allianz and DEG Impact. Managing partner Maurizio Caio highlighted an improved understanding and acceptance of venture capital in Africa among limited partners as a legitimate asset class, which contributed to the successful fundraising.

Consistent Investment Strategy and Focus on Early-Stage Opportunities:

Unlike many VC firms that progress from backing startups in pre-seed and seed stages to later-stage investments with subsequent funds, TLcom maintains a consistent strategy. The firm focuses on traditional sectors like fintech, mobility, agriculture, healthcare, education, and commerce, prioritizing early-stage opportunities, particularly at the seed and Series A stages. TLcom has deployed capital in follow-on rounds at later stages across both funds, with successful investments in Andela, a unicorn provider of global job placement for software developers, and FairMoney, a Nigerian digital bank.

Backing Repeat Founders and Investing Earlier in Deals:

TLcom has improved its risk by backing repeat founders who have gained insights from past ventures. The firm has also invested earlier in deals, such as its pre-seed investments in Autochek and Okra, and its $5 million pre-seed strategy to be disbursed in small check sizes with a low-touch approach. This strategy creates a pipeline to its primary strategy at seed and Series A stages.

Commitment to Gender Balance:

TLcom's commitment to gender balance is evident in its majority-female partnership
meta_desc:
Meta Description: 

"Discover TLcom Capital's $154M commitment to African early-stage startups. Backing repeat founders, investing earlier, and fostering gender balance. Learn more about TIDE Africa Fund II now."

Achievements and Contributions

Throughout her career, Professor Korhonen has been committed to creating AI tools for social and global good. Her work includes developing NLP techniques that can help better understand complex diseases like cancer and dementia, as well as creating educational apps. Her mission is to develop AI that improves human lives, and she strives to inspire the next generation of AI scientists and leaders to focus on realizing AI's potential for positive impact.

Navigating the AI Industry

Despite working in a field with a sizable female population, Professor Korhonen acknowledges the challenges of the male-dominated tech and AI industries. She emphasizes the importance of gender balance, as it influences the priorities of both academia and industry. She encourages women in AI to actively network and support each other to achieve better gender representation, especially in leadership positions.

Pressing Issues in AI

Professor Korhonen highlights the need to prioritize human needs and safety as AI evolves. She stresses the importance of addressing concerns about AI's impact on jobs, democracy, and the environment. She encourages developers to consider ethics during AI development, rather than as an afterthought.

AI User Awareness

Anna Korhonen advises users to be aware that current AI lacks the world knowledge and social context understanding of humans. While AI can be a useful tool for many tasks, she cautions against relying on it for critical decision-making or education.

Responsible

post_title: Mood.camera is an iOS app that feels like using a retro analog camera
title: Mood.camera App: Reliving Retro Photography's Magic for $1.99/mo
post_content:
Title: Mood.camera: An App That Brings Back the Magic of Old-School Photography

In the era of high-tech phone cameras with countless features and granular controls, there's something undeniably appealing about the simplicity and nostalgia of old-school photography. This is the idea that inspired developer Alex Fox to create Mood.camera, a unique iPhone app that captures the essence of retro photography while offering a fresh and fascinating user experience.

At first glance, Mood.camera might seem like any other photography app, allowing users to switch between different retro filters, adjust quality and tone, and switch between lenses. However, it's the app's distinct approach to image processing that sets it apart. Unlike most modern camera apps, Mood.camera does not provide a live preview of the final image. Instead, users see the same viewfinder as they would in their default camera app, creating an element of surprise and anticipation when the photo "develops."

Fox designed Mood.camera with the intent to shift the focus back to the art of photography itself, rather than getting caught up in the effects and editing process. In an interview with TechCrunch, he explained, "Some of the design decisions I made were intended to reduce the conveniences we're used to, urging users to be in the moment instead of worrying about which filter to use or staring at their phone editing."

The app's development began in October 2023, with a beta version released on Reddit earlier this year. Over the last two months, a group of photographers have taken more than 100,000 photos using Mood.camera, helping Fox refine and perfect the app. Users can try Mood.camera for free for seven days, after which they can choose to pay a monthly fee of $1.99 or a one-time fee of $14.99.

Mood.camera isn't the first app to attempt to recreate the magic of retro cameras. In recent years, apps like Lapse, Dispo, and Later Cam have also tried to capture elements of vintage photography by imposing limitations on their functions. While some of these apps have attracted investors and gained popularity, their growth has eventually slowed down.

However, Mood.camera's indie developer approach offers a unique opportunity for long-term success. By providing a sustainable income
